prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin. A channeling prodigy with intense spiritual power. Also the youngest.
Character 2
Name: Will Powers
Description: Was the Steel Samurai. His face is a bit intimidating, so he's got hard luck in showbiz.
Character 3
Name: Security Lady
Description: Member of hotel security. I'm pretty sure her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. Latest field: the seedy world of tabloids.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Juan Corrida
Description: The victim. A young star who played the Jammin' Ninja. Was on bad terms with Engarde.
Character 7
Name: Matt Engarde
Description: Popular young actor who plays the Nickel Samurai. Is rivals with the Jammin' Ninja.
Character 8
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Engarde's manager. An intelligent woman who seems to have it all together.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.
Character 10
Name: Celeste Inpax
Description: Was Andrews' mentor and Corrida's manager. Killed herself two years ago.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor. He disappeared suddenly a year ago.
Character 12
Name: John Doe
Description: The butler of Engarde Mansion. But for some reason, I get the feeling we've met before...
Character 13
Name: Shelly de Killer
Description: A professional assassin. Always leaves a Shelly card near his victim's body.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 2
Name: The Nickel Samurai
Description: A glossy photo Maya pushed onto me. A picture describing the nickel samurai costume.
Evidence 3
Name: Press Conference Ticket
Description: Seems like the Nickel Samurai is to confess something after the post-ceremony stage show.
Evidence 4
Name: Radio Transceiver
Description: Originally from the Bellboy. It can transmit and receive signals over great distances. Originally from Maya's kidnapper, who goes by the name of "De Killer".
Evidence 5
Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: A very expensive item valued at $1,600. It was stolen around the time of the murder. Stolen on the night of the murder. Tabloid article about the victim was in the case.
Evidence 6
Name: Hotel Guidemap
Description: Map of the Gatewater Hotel around the crime scene. A path from the west leads to the viola hall. To the north of the path is engarde and to the south corrida. East of viola hall is the lobby.
Evidence 7
Name: Guitar Case
Description: Found next to the victim. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Bears Corrida's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Wine Glass
Description: Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. No sign it's been drank. Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. Bears Andrews' fingerprints.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Photo of Juan Corrida's murder scene. The victim sits on a chair in a samurai outfit. There is a stab wound on his chest. A glass of juice sits behind him on the dresser. A full bottle of juice sits on the desk in front of him. A open guitar case lies on the floor next to him. Next to the guitar case are the remains of a smashed vase that has stained the carpet with water.
Evidence 10
Name: Autograph
Description: Juan Corrida's autograph. "To my dearest Wendy" is written on it.
Evidence 11
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An "article" from the tabloid "Gossip Land". The contents of the article follow: *Jammin' Midnight Rendezvous!?*

A super-star in an ultra-hot, mega-secret
love scandal!?

Reliable sources say that Juan Corrida
has been getting in close with the
mysterious, yet beautiful manager to the
stars, Ms. A.A.!

Evidence 12
Name: Suicide Report
Description: Deceased: Celeste InpaxFound by: Juan CorridaWas her suicide note hidden?
Evidence 13
Name: Attempted Suicide Report
Description: Attempter: Adrian AndrewsReason: Shock from Celeste Inpax's suicide.
Evidence 14
Name: Juan's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 8:15 PMCause: Strangled with a scarf, then stabbed with a knife.
Evidence 15
Name: Knife
Description: Bears the victim's blood and Engarde's fingerprints. In the grip, "Gatewater" is engraved.
Evidence 16
Name: Jammin' Ninja's Button
Description: Was ripped from his costume. Is covered in Corrida's blood. Found in Engarde's "hakama".
Evidence 17
Name: Lotta's Photo
Description: Picture taken in the Hallway right after the murder. A person in samurai garb stands outside the door.
Evidence 18
Name: Picture Card
Description: Was placed next to the victim at the time of the murder. Ms. Andrews was carrying it.
Evidence 19
Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: Received from Edgeworth. Allows bearer to freely investigate the crime scene.
Evidence 20
Name: Matt's Note
Description: "Please feed my cat, Shoe. My house is just a little ways down from the hotel."
Evidence 21
Name: Spy Camera
Description: Set to record the victim's room from 8 PM for 1 hour. Was running at time of murder.
Evidence 22
Name: Transmitter
Description: Changes the footage taken by the spy camera into radio waves and transmits the data.
Evidence 23
Name: Stuffed Bear
Description: The spy camera was set in its right eye. Found in the victim's room.
Evidence 24
Name: Credit Card Receipt
Description: A receipt for $3,800. Proof Engarde bought a stuffed bear identical to one in evidence.
Evidence 25
Name: Figurine
Description: A wooden bear-shaped figurine. It's covered in many thin cuts. A wooden puzzle with a hollow inside. Only Corrida and Andrews know how to open it.
Evidence 26
Name: Celeste's Photo
Description: Found at Engarde Mansion. "With Love... Celeste" is written on it.
Evidence 27
Name: Celeste's Suicide Note
Description: Found inside the Figurine. It tells of Engarde's horrible misdeeds.
Evidence 28
Name: Pistol
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> A small caliber pistol that is thought to have been fired by De Killer at Franziska.
Evidence 29
Name: Video Tape
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> One of the items retrieved. De Killer violently tried to recover it. Contents unknown.
Evidence 30
Name: Bellboy's Uniform
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.<if asked for details> Worn by De Killer on the night of the murder. One of its special buttons is missing.
Evidence 31
Name: Whip
Description: Thrown away by Franziska von Karma, it has a certain mysterious nostalgia to it.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: This time, I was in that hallway because I had to go to the bathroom!
Person: Powers
Testimony 1
Testimony: And that's when that bellboy I saw earlier came out of the room!
Person: Powers
Testimony 2
Testimony: Of course, when I say "room", I mean Juan Corrida's room!
Person: Powers
Testimony 3
Testimony: Now that I think about it, that bellboy did seem kinda out of place!
Person: Powers
Testimony 4
Testimony: I thought it was kinda strange for a bellboy to come out of a guest's room empty-handed!
Person: Powers
Testimony 5
Testimony: Yeah! So he had to be the assassin! I'm sure of it!
Person: Powers

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this step by step. So, the task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. There's a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies provided.

First, I need to look at all the testimonies given by Will Powers (Testimonies 0-5). Let's go through each one. 

Testimony 0: He was in the hallway to go to the bathroom. Testimony 1: He saw a bellboy come out of the room (Corrida's room). Testimony 2: Confirming it was Corrida's room. Testimony 3: The bellboy seemed out of place. Testimony 4: Strange that the bellboy came out empty-handed. Testimony 5: Concludes the bellboy was the assassin.

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's see if any of these testimonies conflict with evidence. 

Evidence 30 is the Bellboy's Uniform, which was retrieved from De Killer's hideout. The detailed description says it's worn by De Killer on the night of the murder, and one of its special buttons is missing. Additionally, Evidence 16 is the Jammin' Ninja's Button found in Engarde's hakama. But maybe that's not directly relevant here.

If the bellboy (De Killer) was wearing that uniform, then perhaps there's a missing button. But how does that contradict the testimony? The testimony says the bellboy was empty-handed, but if the uniform is missing a button, maybe the button was left at the scene. Wait, Evidence 16 is a button from the Jammin' Ninja's costume, found in Engarde's clothing. Hmm.

Alternatively, let's look at Evidence 30's details: the uniform's special button is missing. If the bellboy (De Killer) was wearing that uniform, then the missing button might be somewhere else. But Testimony 4 says the bellboy came out empty-handed. If the bellboy had the button missing, maybe he left it at the crime scene. But how does that directly contradict?

Wait, maybe another angle. The testimony says the bellboy came out of the room empty-handed, implying he wasn't carrying anything. However, the murder involved a guitar case (Evidence 7) which was found next to the victim. If the bellboy was the killer, maybe he would have had to carry the murder weapon or something else. But the guitar case was already there, so maybe that's not it.

Alternatively, looking at the Spy Camera (Evidence 21-23). The spy camera was in a stuffed bear, set to record from 8 PM. The Video Tape (29) from De Killer's hideout might have footage. But how does this relate to the testimonies?

Wait, the knife (Evidence 15) has Engarde's fingerprints. The Jammin' Ninja's button (16) in Engarde's hakama. So maybe Engarde is being framed. But the testimonies are about the bellboy (De Killer) being the assassin.

Wait, Testimony 5 claims the bellboy was the assassin. But according to Evidence 13, Shelly de Killer is the assassin, and he leaves a Shelly card. Evidence 18 is the Picture Card placed next to the victim, which Ms. Andrews was carrying. Wait, but the Shelly card should be from de Killer. Maybe the Picture Card (18) is the Shelly card? But the description of Evidence 18 says it was placed next to the victim and Ms. Andrews was carrying it. That might be a contradiction if de Killer leaves the card, but Andrews had it. But how does that tie into the testimonies?

Alternatively, Testimony 1 says the bellboy came out of Corrida's room. But if the spy camera (Evidence 21) was recording from 8 PM, which is around the time of death (8:15 PM per Autopsy Report 14), maybe the footage would show the killer. But if the bellboy (De Killer) was the one leaving, then the camera would have captured that. However, if the video tape (29) from De Killer's hideout contains the footage, then perhaps the testimonies about the bellboy would conflict with the video evidence. But I'm not sure.

Wait, the Security Lady (Character 3) is Wendy Oldbag. The Autopsy Report (14) says the cause was strangulation with a scarf and then stabbed. The Knife (15) has Engarde's fingerprints. The testimonies from Powers about the bellboy being the killer (De Killer) would conflict with the knife having Engarde's prints. But the contradiction could be that the testimony points to the bellboy as the killer, but the knife has Engarde's prints, implying he's involved. But the question is about evidence and testimony contradicting each other. So which specific evidence directly contradicts a specific testimony.

Looking at Testimony 4: "Strange for a bellboy to come out of a guest's room empty-handed." If the bellboy was De Killer in disguise (Evidence 30: Bellboy's Uniform), and the uniform is missing a button. But the testimony says he was empty-handed, so he shouldn't have left anything. But the button missing from the uniform could be the contradiction. Wait, but how does that directly contradict Testimony 4?

Alternatively, let's consider Evidence 30 (Bellboy's Uniform) which De Killer wore. The detailed description says one of its special buttons is missing. But the testimony says he was empty-handed, but the missing button (evidence) suggests he left something behind. However, this is a stretch because the testimony is about carrying items, not about losing a button.

Wait, another angle. The Spy Camera (21) was set to record the room from 8 PM. If the murder happened at 8:15 PM, then the camera should have captured the killer. The Video Tape (29) is from De Killer's hideout, which he tried to recover. If the tape shows the actual killer (maybe Engarde or someone else), then Powers' testimony about the bellboy leaving the room would contradict that. But if the uniform is a real bellboy's uniform, then maybe Powers' testimony that the bellboy seemed out of place contradicts that. But maybe the contradiction is that the bellboy's uniform (Evidence 30) is genuine, so Powers' testimony that the bellboy seemed out of place (Testimony 3) is conflicting. Wait, but maybe the uniform is missing a button, making the bellboy look suspicious. So the fact that the uniform is missing a button (Evidence 30) would make the bellboy look out of place, which aligns with Testimony 3, not contradicting. So that's not a contradiction.

Wait, another angle: Testimony 4 says the bellboy came out empty-handed, which is strange. But if the murder involved moving the guitar case or other items, perhaps the bellboy should have been carrying something. However, the Guitar Case (7) is empty and found next to the victim. Alternatively, looking at Evidence 17: Lotta's Photo, taken right after the murder, shows a person in samurai garb outside the door. If the bellboy (De Killer) was in samurai garb, that would match. But the photo shows a samurai, not a bellboy. So if the testimonies say the bellboy was there, but the photo shows a samurai, that could be a contradiction. So maybe the samurai is Engarde (since he's the Nickel Samurai), and the testimonies are about the bellboy, which is a different person. So if the photo shows the samurai (Engarde) at the scene, but the testimony says the bellboy (De Killer) was there, that could be a contradiction. But how do we link that?

So perhaps Engarde was the one who did it, but the testimonies point to the bellboy. So the contradiction would be between the testimony implicating the bellboy and the evidence implicating Engarde. The key is to find a direct contradiction between a testimony statement and a piece of evidence.

Looking at Testimony 5: "So he had to be the assassin! I'm sure of it!" (referring to the bellboy). However, Evidence 13 (Shelly de Killer) is the professional assassin who leaves a card. The Picture Card (18) was found at the scene but was carried by Adrian Andrews. Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, the task is to find one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

Looking at the testimonies from de Killer, specifically Testimony 3 and Testimony 4. Testimony 3 says that Adrian Andrews was pretending to be the first person to discover the body and entered the scene. Testimony 4 claims she already knew Corrida was dead when she entered. Now, the key here is whether there's evidence that shows Andrews actually did something that contradicts her knowledge of the death.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 8 is the Wine Glass with Andrews' fingerprints. According to her statement, she poured the juice for Corrida thinking he was just unconscious. But if she already knew he was dead, why pour the juice? The autopsy report (Evidence 14) says the cause was strangulation and stabbing. If she thought he was just passed out, she might pour juice, but de Killer's testimony says she knew he was dead. The glass's presence with her fingerprints suggests she interacted with the scene, but if she knew he was dead, her action of pouring juice doesn't make sense. That could be a contradiction.

Another angle: Testimony 5 and 6 talk about planting the knife and button. The knife (Evidence 15) has Engarde's fingerprints, which might be planted. The button (Evidence 16) in Engarde's hakama. If de Killer's client (Andrews) planted these, but the button was found in Engarde's clothing. Wait, but according to de Killer's testimonies, he's saying his client (Andrews) planted the knife and button. However, the button was found in Engarde's hakama. But maybe the contradiction is elsewhere. Let me check the evidence again.

Wait, the testimonies from de Killer (Testimony 5 and 6) state that his client (Andrews) planted the knife and button. But the knife has Engarde's fingerprints. If Andrews planted the knife, why would it have Engarde's prints? Unless Engarde is the actual killer, but de Killer is saying the client framed someone else. So if the knife was planted by Andrews, but it has Engarde's prints, that could be part of framing. But maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3 and 4: de Killer claims Andrews knew Corrida was dead when she entered, but in her statement (Evidence 8's testimony), she says she thought he was unconscious. The Wine Glass (Evidence 8) with her fingerprints and her statement that she poured juice for him when she found him, which would make sense if she thought he was alive. But de Killer says she knew he was dead. So this contradicts: if she knew he was dead, she wouldn't pour juice. The presence of the glass with her fingerprints supports her version, but de Killer's testimony says otherwise. Therefore, Evidence 8 contradicts Testimony 4.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this step by step. The question is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts a statement in the testimony.

First, let's look at the testimonies provided by Shelly de Killer (Testimony 0 to 4). Let's go through each one and see if any evidence conflicts with them.

Testimony 3 says that one of the tasks was to find the bear figurine and give it to Adrian Andrews. Now, looking at the evidence, there's Evidence 25: the Figurine, which is a wooden bear-shaped item. The description mentions that only Corrida and Andrews know how to open it. Additionally, Evidence 27 is Celeste's Suicide Note found inside the figurine, and Adrian Andrews says she was going to burn it for her sake. 

Wait, if Adrian already had the figurine and was planning to burn it, that contradicts de Killer's testimony that he was supposed to find the figurine and give it to her. Because if she already had it, there's no need for de Killer to find it. Unless the figurine was taken from her and he had to retrieve it again. But according to the evidence, the figurine was found in the victim's room, and Andrews was in possession of it, intending to destroy it. So de Killer's claim that his task was to find the figurine and give it to Andrews doesn't make sense if Andrews already had it. Therefore, Evidence 25 (Figurine) contradicts Testimony 3.

But wait, let me double-check. Evidence 25's description says the figurine was found at the crime scene, covered in cuts, and only Corrida and Andrews knew how to open it. Andrews mentions she was going to burn it. So if Andrews had the figurine and was going to destroy it, how did de Killer get involved in finding it? Maybe the client wanted de Killer to retrieve it from someone else. But according to the testimony, the client asked de Killer to find it and give it to Andrews. If Andrews already had it, that's a contradiction. Alternatively, perhaps the figurine was in Corrida's possession, and de Killer was supposed to take it from him and give it to Andrews. But in the evidence, the figurine is found in the victim's room, so maybe Corrida had it. But the testimony says de Killer's task was to find it and give it to Andrews. However, if Andrews was the one who had access to it (since she knew how to open it and was planning to burn it), that suggests she already had it. This creates a contradiction because de Killer's testimony implies he needed to find it for her, but she already had it. Therefore, Evidence 25 and Testimony 3 contradict each other.

Another possibility: Testimony 4 says de Killer thought the client was a man because of the name at the end of the letter. But the client could be a woman. For example, if the client was Adrian Andrews, but the name used was male. However, the evidence related to Adrian doesn't directly address this. The magazine clipping (Evidence 11) talks about Juan Corrida and Ms. A.A., which is Adrian Andrews. But I'm not sure if that directly contradicts Testimony 4. The testimony says de Killer thought the client was a man based on the name, but the actual client could be a woman. However, this might not be a direct contradiction unless there's evidence showing the client's name was female. However, the testimonies and evidence provided don't explicitly state the client's identity here. So maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Looking back, the strongest contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 25. If the task was to find the figurine and give it to Andrews, but Andrews already had it (as per Evidence 25 and 27), then that's a contradiction. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 25, "testimony": 3}.
